data.title: Location Offers Easy Access to Restaurants, Cafes, Night Life and Shopping
data.text: This Marriott is a perfect choice for a Lancaster hotel, particularly due to its location.   The rooms with two queen beds are comfortable with an adequate sized bathroom. It is great to be able to walk to some great restaurants, cafes, nightlife and shops right with the general vicinity.  (A must see is the Lancaster Central Market which is open Saturday and limited days during the week).  The hotel restaurant and bar are also good.  While we didn't have a full dinner there, we had lite fair - hummus and vegetables and a caesar salad - that was just perfect to hold us over.  The hotel staff are pleasant and informative.  We self-parked in the public garage, which has reserved spaces for Marriott guests and easy access to the hotel.

data.title: Expansive and Grand Hotel in Perfect Location
data.text: Location is perfect for all things Lancaster. Restaurants, bars, markets, the arts, the convention center. The interior is impressive and tastefully appointed. Friendly and helpful service. The beds comfortable, the bathroom spacious. Convenient valet parking service. The concierge area was clean and the food delicious and plentiful.

data.title: perfect location downtown
data.text: We enjoyed our stay at this outstanding property - connected to the convention center and with lots of restaurants within walking distance.  Valet parking or self-park next door in a public garage with reserved spaces for Marriott guests.

data.title: Great Location
data.text: This hotel is in a great location. Very close to restaurants, bars, arts and the Lancaster Central Market - which is an absolute must if you visit when they are open. The rooms are spacious and offer a comfortable environment. The gym is great and convenient within the hotel. Visit the spa, very relaxing but a little pricey. There is also a pretty good restaurant in the hotel with a bar.

data.title: Outstanding Experience:  A perfect place to surprise someone special
data.text: Last December I took my wife out for a day trip, which I ended up surprising her with an overnight stay at the Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square.  I had let the hotel know of my plans.  Needless to say it was such an outstanding experience for her that she talks about it to everyone that is looking to visit Lancaster.  From the courtesy of the front desk staff, to the beauty of the hotel.  This is a must place to stay whenever your travels take you to Lancaster.

data.title: Great Weekend Getaway
data.text: This is a hotel where everything is done just right, from the greeting at the front door, a friendly and efficient check-in and a nicely appointed room. The exterior is beautiful, the lobby is spacious and attractive, there's a decent bar and restaurant, and you can't beat the location right in the center of downtown Lancaster. No reason to stay anywhere else in Lancaster.

data.title: Great experience; perfect romantic weekend getaway
data.text:
5 stars?  Wow, is this a five-star hotel?  No, of course not.  But we had a fantastic experience, so I'm rating my experience as 5 starts.

We arrived on a busy Friday night, and were met by the valet who explained our parking options.  We chose to self-park, and he suggested we leave our car out front while we unloaded, checked in, and took our bags to our room.  No pressure to use the valet or bell hop services.  That's great customer service right off the bat.  We didn't abuse this, and returned 15 minutes later to park our car.

We checked in with the mobile app, and I requested a high room, and in the comments, a quiet room.  We were treated to a top floor, mid-hallway room which afforded an amazing view of the beautiful town and countryside.  We were far from the elevators and didn't hear any unreasonable noise.

The room was CLEAN.  While Marriott seems to like dated-looking carpet and wallpaper, the linens, pillows, and towels seemed brand new.  The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spotless.  Intermediate housekeeping was good, too.  

The water pressure during the morning shower rush wasn't great, but we accepted the fact that we were in the top floor and shouldn't expect great pressure.  I also showered in the afternoon and the pressure was much better.  The hot water was plentiful at all times, and actually very hot--be careful with the little ones.  There is no fan in the bathroom, so plan ahead...

The TV programming is generous, but most of it is in standard definition.  Wifi was fast and reliable.

The bar area is nice for mingling, and there was free coffee in the morning, which was actually pretty good.  We didn't go to the executive lounge at all during our stay.

The hotel is centrally located with easy access to shopping, dining, and sightseeing.  We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night and the dining options are fantastic; so  we didn't get to take advantage of room service or the restaurant.

There are three elevators, and while they move pretty fast, they can get busy during rush periods.  Bring your patience if you are trying to get up or down during check in/out or breakfast times.

Lancaster is beautiful during the change of season, and the Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square was a perfect base of operations for our weekend.

data.title: Great Hotel. Right in the heart of Lancaster
data.text: Lancaster has been improving quite a lot for the past couple of years. One of the reasons was due to the recent improvement of the hotel, which has made the town much livelier. I stayed for one night and received an upgrade as a Marriott Gold member. The check in process was speedy. There is nothing to complain about the staff and the room. I would definitely stay here again for another business meeting.

data.title: Nothing can be better at this hotel
data.text: Ask you your will receive.  We ask for room 1619 and we got it..  Great room with a view.  Mark Moosic is a great GM at this place,  Adam Shemas helped us get our reservation at this hotel.  Total staff was great... Stayed 6 days.

data.title: Convenient to downtown and F&M
data.text:
We were in town for Parent's Weekend at Franklin and Marshall and wanted a hotel that was both convenient to downtown (for when we weren't on campus) and to the College.  We arrived by Amtrak and didn't have a car, so a convenient location within walking distance of restaurants, bars, shopping, etc. was a must.  You certainly can't beat the Marriott's location. Virtually everything downtown is walkable.  And an Uber from the train station was around $10 and to the College was $7.  We never waited more than 5 minutes for an Uber, which is great in a city the size of Lancaster. (Tip: When calling for an Uber, have them pick you up half a block south of the hotel on Queen Street at the intersection of Mifflin Street. This way the car can go straight up Queen.  If the car picks you up in front of the hotel, it will be forced to take a right hand turn out of the driveway throwing you several blocks our of your way if you are heading anywhere north or west of the hotel.)

The hotel is modern and clean with satisfactory service.  It is a very typical "corporate" high-rise hotel which is far superior to the more typical, touristy, two-story  places in Lancaster that service the Amish Country visitors (such as a Fairfield Inn or Comfort Inn).  Room was plenty large with an up to date bathroom.  There were several large events taking place at the hotel while we were there, but none of them impacted our stay in terms of noise or service.  

Our only complaint was that the Concierge Lounge had awful hours. Closed by 10:00 a.m. on Friday, and closed all day Saturday? And whereas the hours were posted as closing at 10:00 a.m. on Friday, we went up at 9:35 for breakfast and every scrap of food and drink had been removed and the staff was wiping the place down to close it.  We were counting on having breakfast up there, but got shut out and had to look elsewhere. (A staff member did note our disappointment and offered to go to the back to get me a glass of OJ, but she was only able to eek out half a glass from the pitcher.)   If one is coming in for the weekend, why even bother having a Concierge Lounge with those hours?  Most hotels that I stay in might have short "staffed" hours, but they are open 24/7 (with a key) if a guest wants a bottle of water or wants to make a cup of Keurig coffee or grab  an apple..  This one is locked up tight.  Very disappointing and easy to fix.  You do realize that you are charging people more for a Concierge level room, right?  If one checks in on Friday and departs on Saturday, what exactly are they getting for their money?  Certainly no cocktails on Friday evening, and certainly nothing at all on Saturday.   This really, really needs to be addressed.

data.title: In the heart of Lancaster
data.text:
A very nice full service Marriott in the middle of Lancaster.  Excellent service, very well informed of local and area attractions.  Rooms consistent with other full service Marriotts - and maybe even a little better than other locations I have stayed in.

Was very surprised to find this quality in Lancaster.  Was expecting to find the usual road side motels, chain or independent and one or two older full service hotels.  Right in the center of town, close to numerous restaurants, stores and galleries as well as Franklin & Marshall and adjacent to the convention center.  

A really nice alternative to the typical tourist type accommodations usually associated with the area.  And being in the middle of Pennsylvania Dutch/Amish area easy access to the great history, crafts and foods of the Amish.

data.title: The Good and the Bad.....
data.text:
The hotel has a lot going for it. Unlike other reviewers, we found the front desk staff to be helpful. We were in town for a wedding that was held off-site. So many other wedding parties..... The price, at the wedding rate, was high, especially when we found out what the regular prices are (i.e. during the week). Really!! 

If you stay, try to get a room looking out on the front and not the side where the music from some clubs goes on til 1:30 or 2 am. REALLY LOUD. When I called the desk to ask about it and wondered if there was a place to get earplugs, they volunteered that they had some. This should have been distributed in the room.  

Other suggestions: Add better light in the bathroom. Can't see well enough to know how make-up looked.

When people register give them the spa information. By the time we got there, it was too late to book anything on Sunday,

Please stop using sprays that have aromas. Allergens, big time.

Great location, though!

owner_response.author: Michelle R, Manager at Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear SLRS5,

Thank you for taking the time to share a review of your recent stay at our hotel. I am happy to hear our staff provided you with excellent service during your visit. With that said, I do sincerely apologize for any noise disturbance you experienced due to weekend entertainment at a local bar. I can certainly understand your frustration and we will be meeting with our neighbors in an attempt to minimize any impact to our guests moving forward. 

Should you ever return to our hotel, please contact us in advance and we would be delighted to prepare a room for you without the use of our standard cleaning products. We also appreciate your feedback regarding lighting in the bathrooms. During our upcoming renovation, this issue will most certainly be addressed. 

Providing Marriott’s high level of service is our number one priority and we appreciate you letting us know what we could have done better! 

Sincerely,
Michelle Reynolds
Director of Operations
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Historic Gem
data.text:
Apparently this is the wedding destination in Lancaster PA!  We were possibly the only people staying here that weren't involved in the six (yes for real) weddings / receptions taking place this past weekend.  But that doesn't detract from the awesomeness of this place.  Huge, interesting and historic lobby, incredibly helpful staff, good rooms and did I mention the lobby? You couldn't have a better location in the downtown area. 
The only drawbacks were 1) lackluster service at breakfast on one of the two days (the other day was great), and why have waffles served at the buffet without all the fun things to put on them?  2) the hot tub was a bit...off in an otherwise beautiful pool room.
I'm still giving it 5 stars though as I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

data.title: Nice Facility/Location - Needs better service
data.text:
Nice facility, Great. location.  Restaurant was just OK.  Parking was easy and convenient.  Can walk to the hotel from the garage if you do not use valet.

If there was fee parking no one told us about it.  We paid $15.00 over night.

Also you need to use the key to enter the floor number in the elevator and one of the units in the elevator does not work when you enter your key.  Ourselves and other guest keyed the wrong slot trying to indicate the floor while taking a random joy ride. Would would have been nice if that was explained at Check in.

Room service was a nightmare.  There is a new (?) Freshbits room service menu and the staff informed us we could not make any substitutions.  If I'm paing 300/night for a room I'd like to order an omelet like I want it for breakfast.  We were told to come down and order it from the (same!) restaurant to go.  We had to call the restaurant and place a to-go order then call the bell desk to have a bell man deliver the order.  Oy Vey!   Come on Marriott.  You are a premiere name in this business.  You can do better than that.  

Otherwise and pleasant stay.

owner_response.author: Michelle R, Manager at Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Stephen S.,

Thank you for taking the time to complete a review regarding your recent stay at the Lancaster Marriott.

I sincerely apologize for any confusion with regards to needing your room key to access your guest floor from the elevator.  This should have been explained to you by our front desk team.  

There is a nightly charge for parking in the Penn Square garage as the garage is owned and operated by the Lancaster Parking Authority. While we do allow our guests to bill this fee to their guest room as a convenience, you can also pay directly at the booth as you exit, depending on your preference.

Lastly, I am sorry to hear about your disappointment regarding our Fresh Bites program. Marriott has begun evolving room service and chose us to be one of the first hotels to pilot this program. They are moving away from the traditional room service model with a focus on offering fast casual options for guests looking for quick, convenient food. I can certainly understand that some of our guests may not find this change to their liking. In order to facilitate a faster delivery time, we are unable to offer substitutions or deviations from menu. Should our guests have any special requests or needs, we invite them to join us in our Penn Square Grille and Rendezvous Lounge, where we are happy to modify menu items at their request.

Like any new concept, an important part of this process will be to closely monitor our guests’ feedback to determine what elements they like best and which need some improvement. We continue to share our guests’ comments with Marriott so that these likes and dislikes can be addressed in the future.

Stephen S., we are constantly evaluating our team’s performance and closely reviewing our guests’ feedback to identify operational areas that require some improvement. Providing Marriott’s high level of service and comfort to all of our guests is our number one priority and I appreciate you bringing these issues to our attention.  

Sincerely,
Michelle Reynolds
Director of Operations
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Mixed Bag, but noise was a problem
data.text:
Nice location, came for an on-site convention.  The convention room was noisy...and this was a music competition event. Air conditioning units and vent systems banging and hissing, and the lighting was not right either.  
Guest rooms near the elevator are subject to the incredibly loud floor arrival ding-dings; never heard such a needlessly loud bell.  Rooms over the bar, even 9 floors up, will be bombarded with mostly bass sounds and much cacophony until 1:30AM on the weekends.  
I found a coin on the floor of the closet, so perhaps room was not vacuumed everywhere?  Inside of toilet bowl was a little dirty for my preference, and the leak in the tub faucet was called to the attention of the management.  Little annoying housekeeping habit:  all of the drains were left in the closed position after cleaning, meaning I stepped into the shower with water half way up my calf. 
All in all, I've been in better hotels, and in worse.  Somewhat nit-picky review, but these little things were all super obvious together.

owner_response.author: Michelle R, Manager at Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear LaceAce,

Thank you for taking the time to share a review regarding your recent stay at our hotel. I can imagine the frustration you experienced due to the multiple housekeeping issues in your guest room as well as the maintenance issues you mentioned in the convention center. I would like to sincerely apologize for any disappointment you experienced.  We clearly did not meet your expectations – or ours.

I have shared your feedback with both our housekeeping and maintenance departments so that they fully understand how our guests feel when we fail to deliver the service our guests have come to expect from Marriott. Providing Marriott’s high level of service and comfort to all of our guests is our number one priority.

Again, thank you so much for taking the time to make us aware of your experience and letting us know what we could have done better. We are constantly evaluating our team’s performance and closely reviewing our guests’ feedback to identify operational areas that require some improvement. 

Sincerely,
Michelle Reynolds
Director of Operations
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great hotel for convention
data.text:
We made a return visit for the Creating Keepsakes Convention in the convention center attached to the hotel.  Was a bit late in booking our room at the convention rate but managed to get the last room available.  This important as we are going up and downstairs lugging a lot of class materials and vendor floor purchases.

Being Marriott Rewards member we did get free parking and free WiFi.  The staff as very friendly and welcoming.  Check-in and check out were fast and efficient.

We had a large corner room with great views to the north and west.

The location was great and we could walk around the downtown area easily to stores and restaurants.  There is a gym, pool and spa, which we did not have time to use, unfortunately.

data.title: First visit to Lancaster
data.text:
I visited Lancaster for a writing conference and had a wonderful time. Despite the large number of people checking in the process was quick and the clerk was very nice. 

My room had a gorgeous view and both of my room service orders were tasty and nicely packaged. 

The hotel is really close to lots of shopping and restaurants and the farmer's market across is a must visit. 

The only con was the jacuzzi was not functioning during my visit, but the pool was very relaxing. 

I plan on returning soon.

data.title: Great location.  Free parking.
data.text:
Very pleased with my stay.  Room was a little pricey for being in a small town. I would stay there again. 

Nice place to spend a weekend.  You can walk to many restaurants and shops. It doesn't even feel like you're in Amish country.

data.title: Very nice hotel and great location
data.text: While visiting Amish Country my husband and I and two other couples stayed here. Check in was very easy and we got an early check in no problem. Also got free wifi as we were reward members. We did have to pay for parking $18 but they allowed us to use the parking until 5:30 the next day so it was worth it as we had time to walk around the town of Lancaste the next day. The hotel has a nice big lobby and the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. The buffet breakfast was a little pricey but the omlets were very good.  Also the hotel bar is nice and there is a great Irish bar Annie Baileys a short walk away. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the Lancaster area

data.title: Important little things let them down
data.text:
Room was roomy with big windows and nice comfy shower.

But.... When we checked in we expected free wifi as Marriott members.  "No sir, can't find your number in the system, oh you enrolled overseas, sorry" this is from an international company.

Anyway I found number to be told you would need a credit card as well.  Done, wifi works.  Time to checkout, credit card charged for wifi.  Front desk sorted it out (thanks Genises) but really this pees people off.

owner_response.author: Michelle R, Manager at Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Rama1,

Thank you for taking the time to share a review of your recent stay at the Lancaster Marriott at Penn Square.  I sincerely apologize for any frustration or inconvenience you experienced as a result of the billing issue concerning your internet charge.

We have reviewed all related procedures with our front desk team to ensure that this was an isolated incident and is corrected moving forward.

Again, we appreciate you letting us known what we could have done better. Providing Marriott's high level of service is our number one priority and we appreciate your feedback!

Sincerely,
Michelle Reynolds
Director of Operations
owner_response.title: Owner Response
